alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 5:48PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Including the following areas, Matanuska Valley and Susitna Valley. * WHEN...Until 400 AM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Bankfull conditions with areas of minor flooding are likely in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 544 PM AKDT, River gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in the advisory area. This will cause elevated streamflows and areas of small stream flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of up to 1 inch are possible, which will continue the elevated flows through the week. - For Susitna River at Gold Creek: At 4:30pm the stage was 12.22 feet. Flood Stage is 14.0 feet. Forecast: A crest of 12.4 feet is expected at 10:00pm Thursday. For Little Susitna at Houston: At 5:00pm the stage was 9.6 feet. Flood Stage is 11.0 feet. Forecast: A crest of 9.8 feet is expected at 10:00pm Wednesday. For Little Su below Hatcher Pass Bridge: At 4:15pm the stage was 5.09 feet. Flood Stage is 6.5 feet. Forecast: A crest of 5.2 feet is expected at 10:00pm Wednesday. For Matanuska River near Palmer: At 4:30pm the stage was 7.54 feet. Forecast: A crest of 7.6 feet is expected at 10:00pm Wednesday. For Moose Creek near Palmer: At 4:45pm the stage was 16.48 feet. Flood Stage is 17.5 feet. For Skwentna River at Skwentna: At 9:00am the stage was 37.55 feet. Flood Stage is 42.0 feet. Forecast: A crest of 37.6 feet is expected at 10:00pm Wednesday. For Susitna River near Sunshine: At 5:00pm the stage was 21.89 feet. Flood Stage is 24.5 feet. Forecast: A crest of 22.2 feet is expected at 10:00pm Wednesday. For Talkeetna River at the Talkeetna Railroad Bridge: At 5:00pm the stage was 11.69 feet. Flood Stage is 13.0 feet. For Talkeetna River Upstream of Talkeetna: At 4:45pm the stage was 8.64 feet. Flood Stage is 12.5 feet. Forecast: A crest of 9.0 feet is expected at 10:00pm Wednesday. For Willow Creek at Parks Highway: At 5:00pm the stage was 9.65 feet. Flood Stage is 10.0 feet. Forecast: A crest of 9.2 feet is expected at 4:00am Friday. For Willow Creek Upstream of Parks Highway: At 5:15pm the stage was 4.3 feet. Flood Stage is 5.9 feet. Forecast: A crest of 4.6 feet is expected at 10:00am Thursday. For Eklutna Lake near Eklutna: At 5:00pm the stage was 846.78 feet. For Montana Creek near Talkeetna: At 4:15pm the stage was 10.75 feet. Flood Stage is 9.0 feet. Forecast: A crest of 6.4 feet is expected at 10:00pm Wednesday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
